text:
It should be a sign to us that today’s Catholic Gospel reading is the Good Samaritan, where Jesus teaches us to love our neighbors as ourselves and treat them with mercy. Trump’s ICE raids today tear families apart -the opposite of mercy.  
#FamiliesBelongTogether #KnowYourRights http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_cHiH7XUAEEcEq.jpg

RT @RashidaTlaib Want a response to a lawless & complete failure of a President?

He is the crisis.
His dangerous ideology is the crisis. 
He needs to be impeached.

RT @DelgadoforNY19 This is a hateful & disgusting comment. My colleagues are dedicated American public servants who are proudly serving their constituents. They represent the best of the American Dream & make our democracy stronger with diverse experiences & perspectives. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/14/us/politics/trump-democratic-congresswomen.html

3/3:The EU, Canada,Japan,S.Korea, have no restrictions on commerce with #Cuba. So why isn’t Cuba flooded with investment from these countries? Because totalitarian states are not attractive places for foreign investment. And cosmetic political changes won’t change that.

Our job is to bring more and more young people and working class people into the political process. That is where the future of the Democratic Party and this country lies.

You are angry because you don’t believe in an America where I represent New York 14, where the good people of Minnesota elected @IlhanMN, where @RashidaTlaib fights for Michigan families, where @AyannaPressley champions little girls in Boston.

RT @RepBrendanBoyle Like some of my Democratic colleagues, I’m young, from an immigrant family, also very critical of Trump. Funny thing though, he never tells me to “go back where I come from.” Hmm I wonder why? 🤔 https://twitter.com/realdonaldtrump/status/1150381394234941448 QT @realDonaldTrump So interesting to see “Progressive” Democrat Congresswomen, who originally came from countries whose governments are a complete and total catastrophe, the worst, most corrupt and inept anywhere in the world (if they even have a functioning government at all), now loudly......

Let’s be clear about what this vile comment is: A racist and xenophobic attack on Democratic congresswomen. This *is* their country, regardless of whether or not Trump realizes it. They should be treated with respect. As president, I’ll make sure of it. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1150381394234941448 QT @realDonaldTrump So interesting to see “Progressive” Democrat Congresswomen, who originally came from countries whose governments are a complete and total catastrophe, the worst, most corrupt and inept anywhere in the world (if they even have a functioning government at all), now loudly......

RT @tedlieu Hey @realDonaldTrump: What makes America exceptional is we are a nation of immigrants. As an immigrant who served on active duty, I am appalled you are telling us to "go back."

I'm not going back. America is our home. And I will still be in Congress after your racist ass leaves. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1150381395078000643 QT @realDonaldTrump ....and viciously telling the people of the United States, the greatest and most powerful Nation on earth, how our government is to be run. Why don’t they go back and help fix the totally broken and crime infested places from which they came. Then come back and show us how....

I’ve got a message for the Trump administration: When you physically abuse immigrants, sexually abuse immigrants, or refuse to supply immigrants with the medical care that they need, you break the law of the United States of America.

People say, “Bernie, you’re repetitious, you always say the same things."

Well, here’s a promise: when all of our people have health care, when we are leading the world in the fight against climate change, when the poor are no longer struggling, I will change what I’m saying.

I always have a “Mr. Rogers moment” when I put on my sneaks. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_dyHfNXkAAwfXB.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1150508739771928578/vid/320x320/NlpHmwRImpuhAmoo.mp4?tag=13

PrEP is more than 90% effective in preventing HIV yet continues to be underutilized, particularly among communities of color. That’s why I introduced a bill to expand access to PrEP.

But we must also address PrEP’s cost – we can’t allow companies to put profits before patients.

Compassion = ZERO kids in the custody of traffickers. @TomHansberger @MarquetteU @SEIU @FacultyForward It was great meeting you, Tom. Unions should be quick and easy to join—and we can’t win if we don’t fight.

This is why we are going to defeat Trump:

Working people are sick and tired of working more for less.
They're tired of 3 people owning more wealth than the bottom half.
They're tired of not being able to afford health care.

We will expose Trump as a fraud and transform America. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_cpmubWsAATAky.jpg

You are angry because you can’t conceive of an America that includes us. You rely on a frightened America for your plunder.

You won’t accept a nation that sees healthcare as a right or education as a #1 priority, especially where we’re the ones fighting for it.

Yet here we are.

We know that gun licensing has been effective in states like Massachusetts—but almost 70% of all guns recovered in MA came from out of state. We need a national gun licensing program—a state-by-state patchwork approach isn’t enough. https://www.bostonherald.com/2019/07/12/cory-booker-cites-shootings-in-boston-in-plan-to-end-gun-violence/

You don’t belong here.
You’re not one of us.

Same thing we do every week. Fight for:
✅ Living wages & unions
✅ A humane border
✅ Healthcare + edu as rights
✅ Loosening the grip of corp lobbyists on our democracy

They can stay busy defending racism.

We’ve got things to do.

On top of not accepting an America that elected us, you cannot accept that we don’t fear you,either.

You can’t accept that we will call your bluff & offer a positive vision for this country. And that’s what makes you seethe.

From fighting to protect health care for millions & permanently renewing the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund, it’s been a busy week. 1/3:#Cuba isn’t facing a “permanent siege”
- They can freely commerce with 75% of worlds economy
- Current U.S. law allows all sorts of commerce with #Cuba which is the 9th most popular country on Airbnb for U.S travelers & receives over $3.5 billion a year in U.S. remittances https://twitter.com/carlosfdecossio/status/1150459879427051520 QT @CarlosFdeCossio Yet the majority of Cubans support his steady approach to face very challenging odds in a country under permanent siege from the US gov. He enjoys the people's confidence. https://twitter.com/reuterssarah/status/1150132900895047682

I reject @realDonaldTrump’s xenophobic comments meant to divide our nation. Rather than attack Members of Congress, he should work with us for humane immigration policy that reflects American values. Stop the raids - #FamiliesBelongTogether!

Kids are taken from their families under an American flag.

They are left to cough in cages, spread lice, & smell of mucus w bald eagle emblems emblazoned around them.

A few years from now, these 1000s of children will grow to tell their story. We owe it to them to change. https://twitter.com/repspeier/status/1150127768413331467 QT @RepSpeier The 1st sounds we heard before we could see the children held at Ursula were haunting cries of babies & toddlers. I spoke to a dad of a sick 6-month-old girl. She was flushed, listless, her little fists clung tightly to his shirt. Flu, meningitis, typhus, lice & more. #Border http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_YTFg_XsAIr37N.jpg
